item.title: Accessing the filesystem of a running Docker container
item.description: Well that’s neat — there’s a quick-and-dirty trick for accessing the filesystem of a running Docker container from your host machine. Not especially safe, but much quicker than messing around with ssh servers etc. within the container. So, within the proc filesystem, /proc/some-pid/root/ exposes the root filesystem that process some-pid is running on. So we can do the following, to get an interactive shell on that filesystem: Find some process that’s running inside the container, that we can uniquely identify.

item.title: When running 'stack setup' for ghcjs…
item.description: … make sure you don’t have cabal in your path. Otherwise you’ll get odd build errors, and ghcjs will never install: see this issue on the ghcjs issue tracker.
